abstract.text: A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
Unique layer name
Note! This is an experimental feature. It can be changed or removed in future versions.
The opacity of the entire sky layer.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]

A color used to tweak the main atmospheric scattering coefficients. Using white applies the default coefficients giving the natural blue color to the atmosphere. This color affects how heavily the corresponding wavelength is represented during scattering. The alpha channel describes the density of the atmosphere, with 1 maximum density and 0 no density.
Default value: “white”.
The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.
Interface for hosting a custom map style layer.
A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to
(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).
A filled circle.

A color used to tweak the main atmospheric scattering coefficients. Using white applies the default coefficients giving the natural blue color to the atmosphere. This color affects how heavily the corresponding wavelength is represented during scattering. The alpha channel describes the density of the atmosphere, with 1 maximum density and 0 no density.
Default value: “white”.

Position of the gradient center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the gradient center relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the gradient center, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon.
Default value: [0,0]. Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyGradientCenter is in degrees.
A style’s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.
Interface that provides access to elevation data.
The slot this layer is assigned to.
If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.
A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.
Default value: “white”.
A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.
Default value: “white”.
This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.
Defines a radial color gradient with which to color the sky. The color values can be interpolated with an expression using
. The range [0, 1] for the interpolant covers a radial distance (in degrees) of [0,
] centered at the position specified by
Default value: [“interpolate”,[“linear”],[“sky-radial-progress”],0.8,”#87ceeb”,1,“white”].
This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.
The background color or pattern of the map.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
Defines a radial color gradient with which to color the sky. The color values can be interpolated with an expression using
. The range [0, 1] for the interpolant covers a radial distance (in degrees) of [0,
] centered at the position specified by
Default value: [“interpolate”,[“linear”],[“sky-radial-progress”],0.8,”#87ceeb”,1,“white”].
A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.
Default value: “white”.

This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.
Parameters that define the current camera position for a
function.
An icon or a text label.
Marks the position of a slot.

Position of the sun center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the sun relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the sun, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon. When this property is ommitted, the sun center is directly inherited from the light position.
Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyAtmosphereSun is in degrees.
The angular distance (measured in degrees) from
up to which the gradient extends. A value of 180 causes the gradient to wrap around to the opposite direction from
Default value: 90. Value range: [0, 180]
The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.
The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.
A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.
Information about a layer
Intensity of the sun as a light source in the atmosphere (on a scale from 0 to a 100). Setting higher values will brighten up the sky.
Default value: 10. Value range: [0, 100]
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.
Intensity of the sun as a light source in the atmosphere (on a scale from 0 to a 100). Setting higher values will brighten up the sky.
Default value: 10. Value range: [0, 100]
Intensity of the sun as a light source in the atmosphere (on a scale from 0 to a 100). Setting higher values will brighten up the sky.
Default value: 10. Value range: [0, 100]
Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.
Particle animation driven by textures such as wind maps.
A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.
Default value: “white”.
Location Indicator layer.
Layer types that will also be removed if fallen below this clip layer.
A stroked line.

Position of the gradient center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the gradient center relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the gradient center, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon.
Default value: [0,0]. Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyGradientCenter is in degrees.
Defines a radial color gradient with which to color the sky. The color values can be interpolated with an expression using
. The range [0, 1] for the interpolant covers a radial distance (in degrees) of [0,
] centered at the position specified by
Default value: [“interpolate”,[“linear”],[“sky-radial-progress”],0.8,”#87ceeb”,1,“white”].

Position of the gradient center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the gradient center relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the gradient center, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon.
Default value: [0,0]. Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyGradientCenter is in degrees.

Default value: “atmosphere”.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.

Position of the sun center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the sun relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the sun, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon. When this property is ommitted, the sun center is directly inherited from the light position.
Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyAtmosphereSun is in degrees.
Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.

Position of the sun center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the sun relative to 0 degree north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the sun, where 0 degree is directly above, at zenith, and 90 degree at the horizon. When this property is ommitted, the sun center is directly inherited from the light position.
Minimum value: [0,0]. Maximum value: [360,180]. The unit of skyAtmosphereSun is in degrees.
